runs.comm: starts with a length ball, Sibanda plays with the turn but picks out square leg
drags it short on middle, Sibanda though is a little reluctant to hit out this early. Checks his pull and accepts just a single to deep midwicket
chopped into the covers
goes for the reverse sweep this time, drags the flighted ball from outside leg but does not beat point
orthodox sweep for maximum impact! Picked up the ball tossed up, decided it had to go, and slogged it away. Massive power from a massive man
good length ball, pushed through and denied any time in the air, defended into the covers
pushed through just outside off, Sibanda jumps back and tries to hit too hard. Belt down the ground gives only a single
flighted outside off, Hami M leans forward and blocks
straying a bit too straight, and with a new ball there is not going to be much spin. Hami M gets down low and sweeps the ball nice and fine. Clever shot
gets down the track, but he has to play around his front pad after that. Unable to connect, but takes a leg bye into midwicket
heaved away to long-on, Sibanda is expending a lot of energy for very little runs today
while his captain at the other end does very little - picks up the line of the ball and then trusts his strength to sweep anything on middle stump away to the long leg boundary
back of a length on off stump, defended into the cover point region to get off strike

sweeps the fast bowler too! And this was taken from off stump, Masakadza managed to plant that front leg outside off to evade the lbw appeal and then paddled the ball, with lots of help from his inside edge
slower, and shorter just outside off. Hami M had been skipping down the track and suddenly has to check his shot. Seemed set for a pull, but instead softened his hands and blocked
full and tailing into the batsman, who had made room outside leg, Masakadza bunts it to mid-on
oh, that was there too. Legcutter sitting up to be swatted over the top, Masakadza went for it too but the lack of pace duped him completely
full, and at top pace too, Masakadza presents the full face of the bat and that is another exhibition of his bottom-hand fueled power. Simple extension of defence becomes a straight boundary
appeal for caught behind straight away, but this is a lovely start from Mustafizur. Works the angle across the right-hander, and the good length ball zips over the nervous horizontal bat of Sibanda
slips in the wide yorker, and Sibanda is beaten for pace. Top class bowling, and yet it is all effortless
and there is his trademark. The offcutter that pitches outisde leg stump and just rips past the outside edge. Too good.
four balls, four little gold stars for Mustafizur. Another good length ball slid across the right-hander and skips past the outside edge
good length on off stump, defended to point

and there is something we don't see everyday. An overpitched delivery from Mustafizur, which is dealt with by a most pristine straight drive. Solid batting from Sibanda. Good on him to forgot the first four balls of the over

caaatch? No, Kayes the substitute, had come forward, dived, got two hands to it but does not hold on at cover. Hami M was going for a flat-batted slash, but didn't time it because of the lack of pace on it
good length ball, holds on the pitch, Masakadza blocks a touch early and sees the ball almost pop up back to the bowler
attempts the lap sweep over the keeper, but he has got through the shot too quickly this time too

another chance, and another drop. This time it's Shuvagata at short midwicket, moving forward quickly and diving to do all he can to get under it. But to no avail. Lives to slog from outside off again
shaped for the lap sweep, but Mash has bowled it quite full and quite far outside off. Hami M has to adjust to glide it to third man, doesn't connect
good length ball on off stump, punched back down the ground
full and straight, carefully defended
on the pads this time and Hami M has picked it away to short fine leg, misfield does not cost them much
wrong line from Mustafizur again. Targets the batsman's thighs and Sibanda has an easy flight to the long leg boundary.
comes down the track, but has no room to free his arms. Poorly timed chip, lucky that it didn't carry to mid-on
rushes down the track, has a full toss to smear away through the covers. But Sibanda is beaten for pace

if that doesn't make him shift outside off, I don't know what will. Poor over from Mustafizur, keeps bowling back of a length on leg stump and Sibanda has pulled it over the square leg boundary with the greatest ease
good length ball just outside off, defended towards long-on. Mash chases after it in the hopes of stopping the single, but he really had no chance

through Al Amin's legs, and then when he gets the skates on to stop the boundary at third man and flick the ball back, it goes through the legs of the second fielder backing up. Beautiful little dab from Sibanda, as he saw the short ball early and outside off and got good reward for minimum effort
fuller delivery outside off, flicked through midwcket

knocked him over, Sibanda has played on. Smacks the back of his bat, but he really direct that anger at his feet. Good length ball outside off lulled him into an airy push, but his footwork was negligible. That meant the ball had a big gap between bat and pad to exploit and so it did.
goes for the short one, after he had asked the keeper to go back. Left well enough alone
back of a length ball just outside off, directed to square leg
pushed through on leg stump, clipped to deep midwicket
tossed up, a lot slower, on leg stump. Mutumbami eases it behind square leg
that was the arm ball on leg stump and Hami M has to hurry into the flick after stepping outside leg. Single to short fine leg
good length on off stump, Mutumbami waits for it to turn and whacks it to long-on
flighted outside off, pushed into the covers. Loads slower that was.
does not afford any pace for the batsman to work with, which is a good ploy against Masakadza because he loves to sweep. Beaten and hit on the pads
starts with a long hop, Mutumbami pulls to long-on. Looks like he just wants to cruise with singles

down long-on's throat! Simply done by Mahmudullah and as Sabbir pumps his fists, Hami M grimaces. He might well have given Bangladesh the match here. Came down the track, but didn't quite reach the pitch. Went through with the loft and got it off the bottom of the bat. No power can be generated from there
tossed up just outside off, clipped through midwcket
sweet ball-striking. Plays the line of the ball and sweeps it away to the square leg boundary. Pure timing.
dances down the track and drives to long-off, all along the ground
stays beside the ball to try and exploit the open spaces at third man, but that fielder runs in a touch too quickly to take a single

see, even someone as experienced as Williams goes to reverse sweep a bowler he is facing for the first time. Fails to connect because Shuvagata had tossed it up and slowed it down nicely from around the stumps
takes this one on the full and drills it down to long-on
picked away through midwicket as the offspinner stays around the stumps to the right-hander too
crisp strike as Williams steps down the track and lifts a flighted delivery on middle over extra cover
pushed through on middle, Mutumbami dabs it through point and gets across to the other end

huge appeal, it looks tight on impact but the umpire is fine with it! the dangerous Williams is gone. Went for the sweep, but Shuvagata had held the ball back a touch. Hits the batsman on the back leg having fooled him for the lack of pace, but was it in line with off stump? Very very difficult to call...
no feet, inside edge, sneaks past leg stump!
slides down leg and becomes a wide
flicked away through midwicket
they keep sweeping and they keep falling

this is a top edge because he was hitting against the turn. Dragged the good length ball from outside off, he had played the shot under the ball as well meaning he had no chance of keeping it down. Poor choice of shot with two men in the deep
pushed through quicker on middle and off, defended
dabbed to short fine leg for a quick single
leans forward and drives through to cover
invites the drive again but Waller cannot beat the off side infield
jumps back and punches a good length ball down to long-off
tossed up just outside off, Moor defends into the covers in search of a single. No such luck. Great fielding from Bangladesh
drifts on with the arm, Moor defends on off stump
pushes down the ground to long-off
good length ball outside off, caressed through the covers

a lot of time spent to set the field just right, only for a thick outside edge to beat third man. The free hit fetches a boundary. The first one in three overs. Mash had gone full and onto leg stump, Waller had made room and looked for point. He'll settle for the eventual result, surely.
good length ball on middle, defended

that was perfectly adjacent, and the only thing that could have saved Waller was the inside edge. And there was a huge one. Skiddy delivery on off stump nearly beat the batsman as he went for the flick
back of a length and outside off, slid to deep cover

good length ball on middle, picked away through midwicket. Are they going for a second? This could be close, Sarkar is the man with the throw and he would have gotten a wicket if that ball had hit the stumps.
slower ball right on the base of off stump, dug out
shortish and on off stump, Moor makes room and slaps it away through to deep point
flat-batted down the ground! Again, an example of how the front leg is no longer useful in T20 cricket. Shoved it away to make room for the arms to hit through the line
nudged into the midwicket region and it is the wicketkeeper that chases it down
stays back to a relatively fuller ball and clips it between midwicket and long-on. Another two carefully pinched
stays back to a short ball and plays the back cut, but finds point.
pulls out the reverse sweep, does not connect with this flighted ball outside off, Nurul collects it well and clips the bails off. Stumping appeal, but it's been shot down on field
length on off stump, gets the outside edge to third man as Waller looked to belt it through point

moves in line with a good length ball on middle and nudges it to the man on the midwicket boundary. They scamper off for a couple, but the umpire calls one-short. Waller failed to ground his bat behind the line
short of a length on leg stump, pulled to short fine leg
full and tailing into Moor, who swings as hard as he can but only gets an inside edge to deep midwicket
good length ball on leg stump, a lot slower too, nudged to long-on. Another couple for Zimbabwe, but with 74 needed off 31 balls, those can only be so helpful
smashed down the ground! Overpitched from the Bangladesh captain and Moor takes full toll. Looks a strong lad, perhaps why Zimbabwe have pushed him off his usual opener's position.
looks for the base of middle stump, Moor keeps back and whips it through midwicket
full toss outside off stump smothered into the crowd at deep square leg. All he had to do was swivel on his back foot, connect with his pull and his power does the rest.

another full toss, but this time it brings a wicket! He had to go for them, Zimbabwe needed a big over and Waller did choose a sound option - the hit over extra cover. Except Bangladesh had cleverly plugged that gap with one of their better fielders. Sarkar runs to his left and picks up a cool little catch
nails the yorker on leg stump, Moor goes for the flick and fails to connect.
clears the front leg and smears a fuller ball to wide long-off

weathers an lbw appeal straight up, but Al-Amin struggles to get them with his angle from wide of the crease. This was a good length ball that skids past the flick across the line, struck a little high on the pad too and always going down

wild appeal from the wicketkeeper, but again it was a little too optimistic. Daylight between bat and ball as Madziva ran down the track and misses a slog. It was closer to toppling middle stump than behind a catch
full and down leg, wide called as the batsman flicks and misses and almost falls over
there's more evidence that batsmen can't pick up Mustafizur's cutter. Even when they are full tosses outside off stump. Madziva ends up like a revolving door as he attempts a slog
full on middle and the castle is breached! Madziva came down the track and swung across the line, he misses, Musfatizur hit
and he is no match for the cutter. Pitched on leg stump and rips across the closed face of the bat and into the keeper's gloves
full and outside off, Cremer was looking to paddle it fine but is struck on the back pad. Mustafizur goes for an appeal, but the impact was outside off
those stumps are in disarray again! Pin point yorker on middle stump goes through Moor. Beaten on pace. Just take it and go, he says as the Khulna crowd go wild
good length ball outside off, Cremer was looking to turn it into the leg side and ends up with a leading edge to point
swivels on his back foot as he pulls a short ball from outside off to deep square leg
hits the yorker outside off and beats Wellington for pace
back of a length slower ball on leg stump, Wellington goes for a flick but ends up with an inside edge to square leg
leg cutter outside off, Cremer slogs across the line and comes up with a big old zip
slugged to deep midwicket for a single
short ball, pulled to deep square leg
backs away and slaps a flatter ball to long-off
skids onto the right-hander from around the wicket, Cremer pulls to deep midwicket
cuts it from leg stump after making room for himself, still only a single with a man in the deep
swats a good length ball on off stump to long-on for a couple of runs

gets down the track, but had signalled his intent too early. The bowler adjusts, fires it in quick on off stump. Wellington swipes across the line, gets an inside edge and has to hurry back into his crease lest he be run out by the wicketkeeper
right up there on middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket. Kayes was the man running in, bends down to pick it up with one hand but fails to pick the ball up
another irritating yorker for the batsman, who can only dig it out
that time the search for the block hole makes him bowl a low full toss on leg stump, still since it's rather quick, the batsman can't connect with the flick
good length ball outside off, Wellington flashes and misses
full and outside off, drilled into the covers

wicket off the last ball, and its Sabbir again. Offers up a short ball that Cremer goes to pull over the leg side. He was hitting against the turn so ends up with a top edge that goes straight up and falls straight down into the bowler's own hands
